API Reference¶

Notes¶

class noteutil.Line(content, nindex, lindex, rcontent, prefix, extensions, categories, tabs, fmt)¶

A single token of text.

This is all of the text that is found in between two of a NoteUtil’s separators in the .nu file.

content¶

The actual content of the Line; all of the text that was found in between the separators.

Type:str
nindex¶

The Note index that corresponds to the position in the NoteUtil.notes_list.

Type:int
lindex¶

The Line index that corresponds to the position in the NoteUtil.lines_list.

Type:int
extensions¶

A dict of the Extensions that this Line has with key: Extension.name and value Extension.

Type:dict of {str : Extension}
categories¶

An unsorted list of all of the Categories this Line belongs to.

Type:list of Category
class noteutil.Pair(content, nindex, pindex, separator, rcontent, prefix, extensions, categories, tabs, fmt)¶

A single token of notes with a separator that splits a term and a definition.

A Note will automatically become a Pair if its separator is in the rcontent of the Note. This holds true unless the rcontent contains the prefix of a LineGroup.

content¶

The actual content of the Notes; all of the text that was found in between separators.

Type:str
nindex¶

The Note index that corresponds to the position in the NoteUtil.notes_list.

Type:int
pindex¶

The Pair index that corresponds to the position in the NoteUtil.pairs_list.

Type:int
separator¶

The string that separates the key and value (term and definition) of the Note token.

Type:str
term¶

The first part of text that came before the separator.

Type:str
definition¶

The second part of text that came after the separator.

Type:str
extensions¶

A dict of the Extensions that this Pair has with key: Extension.name and value Extension.

Type:dict of {str : Extension}
categories¶

An unsorted list of all of the Categories this Pair belongs to.

Type:list of Category

Extensions¶

class noteutil.LineExtension(content, name, eindex, rcontent, cindex, note, placeholder, before, lbound, rbound, fmt)¶
content¶

The content of the Extension excluding bounds.

Type:str
name¶

The name assigned to this Extension, used as a key in NoteUtil.extension_dict.

Type:str
eindex¶

The Extension index that corresponds to the position in the list found with NoteUtil.extension_dict[Extension.name]

Type:int
note¶

The Note that this Extension was found in.

Type:Note
class noteutil.PairExtension(content, name, eindex, separator, rcontent, cindex, note, placeholder, before, lbound, rbound, fmt)¶
content¶

The content of the Extension excluding bounds.

Type:str
name¶

The name assigned to this Extension, used as a key in NoteUtil.extension_dict.

Type:str
eindex¶

The Extension index that corresponds to the position in the list found with NoteUtil.extension_dict[Extension.name]

Type:int
separator¶

The string that separates the key and value (term and definition) of this Extension’s content.

Type:str
term¶

The first part that came before the separator.

Type:str
definition¶

The second part that came after the separator.

Type:str
note¶

The Note that this Extension was found in.

Type:Note
class noteutil.ListExtension(content, name, eindex, separators, rcontent, cindex, note, placeholder, before, lbound, rbound, fmt)¶
content¶

The content of the Extension excluding bounds.

Type:str
name¶

The name assigned to this Extension, used as a key in NoteUtil.extension_dict.

Type:str
eindex¶

The Extension index that corresponds to the position in the list found with NoteUtil.extension_dict[Extension.name]

Type:int
separators¶

# TODO: This should be in Groups The first string separates each ListElement. Any later strings indicate the prefix needed to nest the ListElement a certain number of tabs. There must be at least one separator in separators.

Type:list of str
elements¶

All elements created from the tokens between the separators.

Type:list of ListElement
note¶

The Note that this Extension was found in.

Type:Note
class noteutil.ListElement(rcontent, content, list_ext, tabs: int)¶
rcontent¶

Raw content, what the content was before any additional formatting.

Type:str
content¶

The content of the ListElement, including any prefixes or other modifications.

Type:str
list_ext¶

The ListExtension that this ListElement belongs to.

Type:ListExtension
class noteutil.BulletListExtension(content, name, eindex, separators, bullets, spaces, rcontent, cindex, note, placeholder, before, lbound, rbound, fmt)¶
content¶

The content of the Extension excluding bounds.

Type:str
name¶

The name assigned to this Extension, used as a key in NoteUtil.extension_dict.

Type:str
eindex¶

The Extension index that corresponds to the position in the list found with NoteUtil.extension_dict[Extension.name]

Type:int
separators¶

The first string separates each ListElement. Any later strings indicate the prefix needed to nest the ListElement a certain number of tabs. There must be at least one separator in separators.

Type:list of str
bullets¶

The bullets that will be used to prefix each ListElement. The first string will be the bullet of the ListElement with no tabs, second with one tab, etc. If there are fewer bullets than separators, the bullets will repeat starting from the beginning. There must be at least one bullet in bullets.

Type:list of str
spaces¶

The number of spaces between the bullet and the content of the ListElement.

Type:int
elements¶

All elements created from the tokens between the separators.

Type:list of ListElement
note¶

The Note that this Extension was found in.

Type:Note
class noteutil.NumberListExtension(content, name, eindex, separators, continuous, rcontent, cindex, note, placeholder, before, lbound, rbound, fmt)¶
content¶

The content of the Extension excluding bounds.

Type:str
name¶

The name assigned to this Extension, used as a key in NoteUtil.extension_dict.

Type:str
eindex¶

The Extension index that corresponds to the position in the list found with NoteUtil.extension_dict[Extension.name]

Type:int
separators¶

The first string separates each ListElement. Any later strings indicate the prefix needed to nest the ListElement a certain number of tabs. There must be at least one separator in separators.

Type:list of str
continuous¶

Whether to continue the number sequence if the next ListElement has a different number of tabs.

Type:bool
elements¶

All ListElements created from the tokens between the separators.

Type:list of ListElement
note¶

The Note that this Extension was found in.

Type:Note
